title: Autism Diagnosis and Support
subtitle: Specialized Assessment and Supportive Therapy for Individuals on the Autism Spectrum
description: Autism is a unique way of experiencing and interacting with the world. Our specialized team provides comprehensive assessment, diagnosis, and supportive therapy to help individuals on the autism spectrum thrive and reach their full potential.
fullDescription:
Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) is a neurodevelopmental condition that affects how individuals communicate, interact, and process information. At Allegro Counselling, we recognize that autism is not a disorder to be cured, but a different way of being that comes with unique strengths and challenges.

Our comprehensive autism services include thorough assessment and diagnosis for children, adolescents, and adults, followed by personalized support that honors neurodivergent ways of thinking and being. We understand that each individual on the spectrum is unique, with their own strengths, challenges, and support needs.

Whether you're seeking diagnosis for yourself or your child, looking for support with social communication, sensory processing, or executive functioning, or wanting to better understand and embrace your autistic identity, our experienced team is here to help. We believe in a strengths-based approach that celebrates neurodivergence while providing practical support for daily challenges.

Our approach combines evidence-based therapeutic techniques with a deep understanding of autism, helping you develop strategies that work with your unique brain rather than trying to make you fit into neurotypical expectations. From improving social skills and communication to managing sensory sensitivities and building self-advocacy, we're committed to supporting your journey toward greater confidence and fulfillment.

faqs.question: Can adults be diagnosed with autism?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! Many adults are diagnosed with autism later in life. Adult diagnosis can provide clarity and access to support services.

faqs.question: How long does the assessment process take?
faqs.answer: A comprehensive autism assessment typically takes 2-3 sessions, including clinical interviews, standardized questionnaires, and behavioral observations.

faqs.question: Do you work with children and adolescents?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide autism assessment and support for children, adolescents, and adults. We work closely with families and schools.

faqs.question: What if my child has autism and other conditions?
faqs.answer: Autism often co-occurs with ADHD, anxiety, depression, and other conditions. We provide integrated treatment that addresses all aspects.

faqs.question: Do you provide ABA therapy?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer ABA therapy and other evidence-based approaches for autism support, tailored to individual needs and preferences.

faqs.question: How can I support my autistic child?
faqs.answer: We provide parent education and support to help you understand your child's autism, develop effective strategies, and create a supportive environment.

faqs.question: Do you help with sensory processing issues?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide support for sensory processing challenges, helping individuals develop strategies to manage sensory sensitivities and overload.

sections.title: Understanding Autism as Neurodiversity
sections.description: We view autism as a natural variation in human neurology, not a disorder to be fixed. Our approach celebrates neurodiversity and focuses on understanding your unique autistic traits, strengths, and challenges while supporting your authentic self-expression.

sections.title: Sensory-Aware and Accommodating Environment
sections.description: We create a sensory-friendly therapeutic environment that respects your sensory preferences and needs. Our approach accommodates different communication styles, processing speeds, and sensory sensitivities to ensure you feel comfortable and understood.

sections.title: Strengths-Based and Person-Centered Support
sections.description: We focus on your unique strengths, interests, and abilities while helping you develop strategies for areas where you need support. Our goal is to help you build confidence, self-advocacy skills, and a positive autistic identity.

sections.title: Comprehensive Life Skills and Social Support
sections.description: We provide support across all areas of life including social skills, executive functioning, emotional regulation, and daily living skills. We work with you to develop practical strategies that help you navigate the world while honoring your autistic neurology.
